logentry.author: sl4mmy
logentry.msg: Create a single location for listing the location of every dependency across the whole project; build scripts will reference individual artifacts by id. This will make it easier to identify and remove duplicate dependencies, move dependencies, and upgrade dependencies. Only the main module's dependencies are currently listed.

I think there's something else I'm missing...

logentry.msg:
fix for CC-976: using jvmarg value=... causes the following error in the build under linux:
-start.smoke.testing.server: [echo] stopping any running jetty server [echo] starting jetty server [java] Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: [java] Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: [java] at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:200) [java] at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) [java] at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:188) [java] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:303) [java] at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) [java] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248) [java] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(ClassLoader.java:316) [java] Could not find the main class: . Program will exit. [java] Java Result: 1
using jvmarg line=... appears to fix the problem.

logentry.author: bhamail
logentry.msg: Added Lookup Services control feature to the Agent Utility. Allows you to stop a LookupService and it's ClassServer. NOTE: We can always stop a LookupService, but the Swing Agent Utility can only stop the ClassServer on the localhost and the JMX Agent Utility can only stop the ClassServer on the host running the JMX server.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: CruiseControlConfig: LabelIncrementers are no longer special cased, they are now treated like any other plugin. They must now be added to a project to get a non-default label incrementer and they can be registered with any name; are no longer forced to be named 'labelincrementer'. You can no longer set the labelincrementer classname via JMX. This change is not backwards compatible for users that were registering an alternative label incrementer but not placing the <labelincrementer> element in each project.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: add note that we're moving JDK to 1.5

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: CVS: Add attribute 'recurseLocalWorkingCopy' which allows localWorkingCopy to point at a directory not under version control; reduces effort when project has multiple projects in parallel directories under a non-versioned root (CC-820). Based on patch by Detlef Keil.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: Dashboard: Added ability for users to override the maximum artifact file size that can be viewed without downloading by setting the context parameter 'download.threshhold' (CC-821).

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: CompositeBuilder: Improve processing of build results to make it faster with large log files (CC-826). Patch by David Webster.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: Dashboard: Fix bug where tests that took > 1000 seconds would cause an exception that prevented the build detail page from displaying (CC-828).

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: ModificationSet: When there are multiple source controls attempt to merge conflicting properties by choosing the 'largest' value, to address situation where multiple source controls should return the newest version number or date (CC-830).

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: ArtifactsPublisher: Add option to move instead of copy artifacts which can save time (CC-833). Patch by Grzegorz Oledzki.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: Fixed a bug where time builders could be hidden by a multiple builder earlier in the file (CC-839). Now Builders are evaluated by time, then by multiple and then by day.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: DateFormat: The ability to set the date format in the build loop has been removed. This fixes the issue where setting the date format on one project would affect all of them (CC-355), would cause build status messages to not display in the reporting application (CC-797). Build loop now uses ISO 8601 format for storing date stamp information (CC-353) which is a change from the previous default format.

logentry.author: pauljulius
logentry.msg:
Upgraded to ant 1.7.0 for the embedded ant. Was having trouble getting the connectfour build to run correctly in the binary distro. Was getting an error like:
[cc]Aug-14 20:31:53 ScriptRunner - Invalid implementation version between Ant core and Ant optional tasks. [cc]Aug-14 20:31:53 ScriptRunner - core : 1.7.0 [cc]Aug-14 20:31:53 ScriptRunner - optional: 1.6.5
So, updating to 1.7.0 across the board, and building the distributions with 1.7.0.

logentry.author: pauljulius
logentry.msg: Tabs to spaces. CruiseControl's historical approach is 4 spaces in place of any tab characters.

logentry.author: pauljulius
logentry.msg: Source distro was broken because the dashboard build had a "file scoped" jsmin taskdef with a build-time dependency on main/dist which won't be there until after the main build runs. But, since the root build starts with a clean, the dashboard build was failing before being able to run the clean. Fixed this by narrowing the scope of the jsmin taskdef to the target where it is actually needed.

logentry.author: bhamail
logentry.msg:
CC-686 : add a Progress signaling api to allow plugins to notify the system of their progress as they execute (at first, only Builders).
Adds an optional "showProgess" tag to <schedule> and the builders: <composite>, <maven>, <maven2>, and CCDist <distributed>. Progess messages are shown on the reporting/jsp project pages, below the project state text.

logentry.author: pauljulius
logentry.msg:
This is a larger checkin than I would have liked, due to time constraints. But does contain several improvements/bug fixes for 2.7.1.
dashboard ====================== NOTE: The dashboard has known display issues in Internet Explorer 6. * Allowed artifacts to be shown and downloaded in case of a failed build * Allowed project name to contain hyphen (-) * Allowed integration with project management tools * Allowed using dashboard-config.xml to configure the dashboard * Deprecated the way to configure the dashboard via web.xml * Applied the patch of CC-436 which committed by Szczepan Faber * Fixed CC-656 : Compound Publisher * Fixed CC-665 : error details are missing in the dashboard * Fixed CC-670 : Dashboard can't parse logfiles with testsuite elements without time attribute * Fixed CC-671 : Dashboard can't parse logfiles with non-default date formats
packager ---------------------- * Init script improvments based on patch by Nicolas Ternisien * Upgrading a package will no longer overwrite users config * Packages now depend on Java and subversion * Package now includes dashboard and cc-config * Now includes working connectfour sample * Stops CruiseControl on uninstall * Now only builds CruiseControl if needed

logentry.author: PaulJulius
logentry.msg:
* Added jmxport and rmiport parameters to the embedded jetty server that are passed to the dashboard. * Added the clean targets for the subbuilds to the main build, so that cleaning at the root will actually clean everything.
Dashboard * Tidied the failed and building pages, so that the text is aligned accordingly and does not leak out of the colored box. * Performance enhancements to the active build page. * Documentation enhancements, and updated to use newest screenshots. * Reorganize the modifications tab so that messages are ordered. * Clarified the administration page so that the difference between the config file location and config file editor is clear. * Made hyperlinks clearly delineated. * Fixed issue with refs to default servlet which would break in other web containers. * Fixed bug with newly added projects reporting incorrect build times. * Fixed broken link from active build page after build completed. * Disabled configuration panel for inactive projects. * CSS commenting to make clearer. * Created documentation on writing "widgets". * Enhanced reds and greens on the dashboard to provide a better sense of the state of the entire enterprise. * Renamed "Last 25 Builds" to "Latest Builds" to more accurate. * Fixed bug in project summation reporting the wrong number of builds. * Fixed bug with remaining time calculation. * Fixed bug where forcing a build wouldn't update the project statistics. * Swapped the All Builds and All Successful Builds icons so that the wording and placement would make them more intuitive.

logentry.msg: Enhancement to enable Cruise to work with the cctray distributed as part of CruiseControl.net. Patch by Davie Moston. Install cctray from http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=71179 Then run cctray, select setting from the tray icon, then add, add server, "Use Custom URL" with a URL of "http://YOUR_SERVER/cruisecontrol/xml", then select the project you want to monitor and hit OK.

logentry.author: bhamail
logentry.msg: change Maven2Script to pass altered build property values that contain spaces (ie: -Dcvstimestamp=2006-11-29 03:41:04 GMT) replacing spaces with underscores (ie: -Dcvstimestamp=2006-11-29_03:41:04_GMT). Any combination of quoting causes maven to improperly parse the command line. Since this is an internally generated CC property, I think this is safe, and at least ensures some form of the cvstimestamp value is available during the maven2 build.

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg:
Overhaul handling of threads, streams and logging when executing external processes.
Summary: Make it easier to just execute an external command and to send the output to the log. Removed implicit copying to System.out in StreamPumper now it will only send the output to a StreamConsumer. This forces code to explicitly send output to System.out or System.err if that's desired.
Details: - new StreamLogger class for consuming a stream and sending it to the log. - new DiscardConsumer class for discard a stream. - new CompositeConsumer class for copying a stream to several StreamConsumers. - new CommandExecutor class for executing a command line and logging it's output. - new Commandline.executeAndWait() method for just executing the command and logging the output. - new Processes.waitFor() method for logging a process output and waiting for it to finish for when the command was not constructed using Commandline. - do not send process output to System.out or System.err but to the log as either info or warnings messages. Avoids problem with error messages only going to the console but not the log. - do not start a new thread for consuming extra output (getRidOfLeftoverData), just do it in the current thread. Avoids problem with resource exhausting on some system caused by many short lived threads. - wait for the thread that is consuming error output to finish before closing the process' streams. Avoid problem with invalid handle when reading from a closed stream.

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg: Use a XSLT parameter to control when a PMD violation should be considered an error or a warning and change the default to consider all violations warnings. Previous threshold can be activated by uncommenting the xslt.pmd.warning.threshold parameter in web.xml

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg: Only report the CheckStyle errors but not warnings on the build results page. If there is no error report the warnings count if there is any. Normal CheckStyle configurations will have severity=error for all checks, this change will be minimal for them.

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg: java.io.File's javadoc recommends to use File.toURI().toURL() instead of File.toURL() but that is not compatible with JDK 1.3

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg: Changed the transform method to take an URL instead of an InputStream. After this change the special URIResolver which it's unclosed stream is not needed anymore because the transformer can find resources now. If a transformer is given a Source with a system identifier (that's XML speak for an URL) it will lookup resources relative to that systemId.

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg: Initialize the UNITS map in the static constructor -- avoids reinitializing it for every instance. And now that it's never modified it can be a unsynchronized HashMap instead of a synchronized HashTable. Directly put the units label in the UNITS map without going through an array first it's clearer this way (week and month where actually swap but that was not obvious)

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg:
testBuildRequiresSchedule() was failing most of the time on Mac OS X as reported by Michael Kloss. This seems to be caused by a JVM thread schedule timing. Apparently Sun's JVM takes longer to start the new Project thread and project.build() is called before the project is stopped by the NullPointerException.
Use a MockProject that loops forever instead of a normal Project that will throw a NullPointerException in run() and then stop the project.

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg: Simplify the ArtifactsLinkTag to by reusing BuildInfo and findLogFile(). Which is now possible as: - findLogFile() is moved from XSLTag to CruiseControlTagSupport as the artifacts tag has similar code - the datestamp in BuildInfo is exposed as a String as the artifacts tag is trying to parse the log name for it

logentry.author: hack

logentry.author: hack

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg:
Move log file code from NavigationTag to LogFile. Now LogFile is the only class (beside the log filters which uses the LogFile information) responsible for handling the log file's extension and only expose the log's name without extension.
NOTE: there is one semantic change: NavigationTag no longer can parse log files with a timestamp without seconds which is has supported since revision 1.1. This should not be a problem as log file filters no longer accept such files either.

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg: Add some javadoc: Creates a link to this page excluding one request parameter. By default the parameter excluded is log.

logentry.author: hack
logentry.msg: Move more XML log file code into the LogFile class: - move finding the latest log file and the latest successful logfile from CruiseControlTagSupport to LogFile - only accept file names longer than LOG_PREFIX + LOG_DATE_PATTERN in CruiseControlLogFileFilter so log.xml will not be found - new CruiseControlSuccessfulLogFileFilter that consolidates the is successful test - convert BuildInfo to relay on LogFile.isCompressed() and the new CruiseControlSuccessfulLogFileFilter

This patch moves the responsibility of wrapping the current build status text from the publisher/listener/bootstrappers to the jsp and jsp taglib. Because of the span, it always made the text use the white foreground, which is not ideal when we have a white background. I also replaced the
element with a newline. The JSP tag will convert the newline into a
. Again, this makes sense since jsps should be handling the display aspects. Patch by Anil Arora via Jerome Lacoste's moca build.

logentry.author: pauljulius
logentry.msg:
Allow preconfiguration of nested elements! Tested it with root & projects tlugins and global & project property resolution.
The implementation was eased by the following properties of the current implementation: - validate() is only called when the plugin is given to the user. If it had been called earlier, that would have created some issues.
For the curious the implementation manipulates the DOM. Hence when I find a plugin, I register it (map name & class), and modifiy a copy of the DOM so that
<plugin name="plugname" class="xxx".,..> <....> </plugin>
is changed into
<plugname .,..> <....> </plugname>
Then I can reuse all existing configuration code.
We also remove the defaultProperties as they become redundant.
Note: it is not possible to preconfigure a plugin argument of name 'name' or 'class' for obvious reasons. We should update the doc for that.
Patch by Jerome Lacoste (jerome@coffeebreaks.org)

The implementation was eased by the following properties of the current implementation: - validate() is only called when the plugin is given to the user. If it had been called earlier, that would have created some issues.
For the curious the implementation manipulates the DOM. Hence when I find a plugin, I register it (map name & class), and modifiy a copy of the DOM so that
<plugin name="plugname" class="xxx".,..> <....> </plugin>

We also remove the defaultProperties as they become redundant.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: patch from Dan Rollo: 1. Use the Jini helper class suggested by Jeff Ramsdale (instead of manual lookup/leasing logic). 2. Four new, optional tags to the "distributed" element to allow for overriding of the default locations for files on the agent and master machines: agentlogdir, masterlogdir, agentoutputdir, masteroutputdir. 3. Changed build tree to compile into "target" dir with "classes" and "classes-test" (like main tree). 4. Added checkstyle (like main tree). 5. Changed default build to run unit tests. 6. Added a bunch of unit test of Jini services and various distributed classes. 7. Fix unit test that was leaving some temp files after tests run. 8. Minor readme changes, and added my name to the guilty parties list. ;)

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: Patches by Dan Rollo: 1. build.xml: include jakarta-oro-2.0.3.jar from main/lib in classpaths 2. README.html: cleanup of my prior patch changes 3. conf/master-build.xml: add jar with required classes to paths 4. DistributedMasterBuilder.java: rethrow RuntimeExceptions from build() method in CCException so build loop knows about the problem. Flag found agent as claimed. Also, use updated isBusy() in searching for available agents. 5. ZipUtil.java: avoid creating empty zip files, and ensure such streams areclosed. 6. BuildAgent.java: increase registration wait time to work better under jdk1.4 7. BuildAgentService.java: added claim() method to flag an agent as busy asap. 8. BuildAgentServiceImpl.java: synchronize access to busy flag. Implement isBusy() method. 9. PropertiesTestHelper.java: check for expected exception message in test 10. ZipUtilTest.java: Update test involving empty zip files (which are no longer created). Also ensure temp test files are actually deleted.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg:
New plug-in type 'Listener'. Listeners are notified with events that extend ProjectEvent. Initial Listener implementation CurrentBuildStatusListener listens for ProjectStateChangedEvent and replaces CurrentBuildStatusBootstrapper & Publisher.

logentry.author: pauljulius
logentry.msg:
Alpha 1 of the CruiseControl configuration editor.
***Still a work in progress. ***
Currently can open a CC config file and view a tree representing the elements in the config. The attribute values are displayed. CanNOT save the configuration file once editted. Does NOT work with plugins registered within the CC config file, i.e. only works with default plugins found in the plugin registry. Still ironing out some of the subelements, like Always, Never, Failure subelements of email. ConfigurationEditor contains a main method to run the editor.

logentry.author: pauljulius
logentry.msg: Fixed a bug with the PluginRegistry. Changed the Plugin class loading to not happen until the plugin is used. That's because some plugins might be registered in the default registry, i.e. starteam, that don't exist in the classpath.

logentry.msg: Further elaboration of the PluginRegistry class. It now acts as a real registry used by the ProjectXMLHelper. The case-insensitive nature of plugins is now encapsulated by the PluginRegistry class.

logentry.author: pauljulius

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: pulled Build Artifact link out of header.xsl and created new ArtifactsLinkTag. ArtifactsLinkTag is a body tag that publishes the variable artifacts_url in nested scope where the value is dependent on the project and the log currently being viewed. main.jsp has been modified to use this tag to insert the link to the Build Artifacts. In creating this new tag class I moved some logic from XSLTag to CruiseControlTagSupport and updated the test files to match. logentry.author: pauljulius
logentry.msg: While tracing plugin subelement parsing, came across addAlwaysAddress method which was adding a String to a List. The List is supposed to only contain Always instances. Although the addAlwaysAddress method, and addFailureAddress, are no longer called, they were misleading and a potential future bug. Removed these methods. Also, to enable the compiler to help us with this sort of error, switched the alwaysAddresses, failureAddresses, and emailMap from List to arrays of their respective data type.

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg:
Multiple changes to support JSP 1.1 (Tomcat 3.3; also tested with Tomcat 4.1.24)
- main.jsp: jsp:includes have been inlined. this is because jsp 1.1 requires flush=true on jsp:includes and you can't have flush=true in the body of a custom tag. Thus the way we were constructing the tabs didn't work with JSP 1.1.
- CruiseControlTagSupport extends TagSupport: in JSP 1.1 instances of BodyTag are not allowed to return EVAL_BODY_INCLUDE.
- added CruiseControlBodyTagSupport: this is to support those tags that use the body content. Extends CruiseControlTagSupport and implements BodyTag.
- NavigationTag, TabSheetTag, XSLTag: now extend the CruiseControlBodyTagSupport

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg:
Major goal: improve ease of use by adding default values and reducing number of required attributes and elements
ProjectXMLHelper - Schedule is now a plugin - ModificationSet & Schedule are created using configurePlugin - validate called no ModificationSet & Schedule - interval & quietPeriod no longer required attributes - bootstrapper, log and publishers no longer required elements - logDir now defaults to "logs/projectName"
Schedule - interval has default value of 300 seconds (5 minutes) - validate fails if there is not at least on builder
ModificationSet - quietPeriod has default value of 60 seconds - validate fails if there is not at least on sourcecontrol
PluginXMLHelper - added skipChildElement flag which allows plugins like Schedule and ModificationSet to be configured without configuring their child elements
Project - interval now comes from Schedule - extracted checkLogDirectory so it can be overriden by MockProject
VssBootstrapper - updated message with correct attribute name
CruiseControlController - added TODO comment
test/**/*.java - updated to match

logentry.author: jfredrick
logentry.msg: fixed problem where _buildForced wasn't being reset. introduced build queue: execute is no longer an infinite loop now runnable. run() is a scheduling loop. rename mutex to pausedMutex introduced scheduleMutex and waitMutex moved waitForNextBuild from Schedule moved forceBuild from Schedule moved formatTime from Schedule replaced _status string with state int: introduced static state fields introduced String array of stateDescriptions refactored getStatus() changed _wasLastBuildSuccessful to default to true. avoids building first time if no modifications found. increased log level from debug to warn when aux log has exception while parsing extracted method getModificaitons() extracted Date parseFormatedTime(String timeString) extracted String getFormatedTime(Date date). Replaced getBuildTime(). introduced static ONE_SECOND field renamed _sleepMillis to buildInterval removed __now and getNow(). no longer used after refactoring ProjectTest.testBuild() reformated

logentry.author: gurun
logentry.msg: UPDATE/NEW: Working complementary presentation solution. Sort of a packaging feature that comes with a sourcecontrol (if you like). Try it out using the XSLT in the changelist subdir instead of the defaults. Test that against the sample data also provided or do a real run with perforce (the only element so far that has this extension implemented).

logentry.author: gurun
logentry.msg:
NEW: Added the ability for each sourcecontrol to control it's representation all the way out to the presentation layer. The idea of this is acctually stolen from isMobile best practice, but not secret :-) The defenition of the method getModifications() has now change. The contract now say that you either return a List of Modification's or a List of org.jdom.Element's. ModificationSet then checks to see wichever it is. It also works in mixed mode, using different sourcecontrols within the same modificationset. NOTE: Sort is removed from modificationset now, but I will fix this in the stylesheet instead (where it probably should be anyway, CC istelf doesn't care). Etc, etc.
TODO: Still not commited, but allready working is also a complementary presentation solution. Sort of a packaging feature that comes with a sourcecontrol (if you like). There are defaults and this change is backwards competable for all elements except Perforce (for now). But this only means that perforce needs it own XLS setup (on parts only). This is expected to be customized by each user anyway so it's not really a problem. Expect this to be commited in a couple of days or so.

logentry.author: gurun
logentry.msg: Removed left over import. Jikes doesn't like them.

logentry.author: gurun
logentry.msg: BUGFIX: Changed to leading forward slash on all XSL paths. Works on all Tomcat versions and tested on Orion-server. The XSL tag in Cruisecontrol uses servletContext.getResource() to retrieve the stylesheets. There is a problem at least in Orion if you don't specify with leading slash, because it expects that. Probably becuase Orion concatenates string paths instead of using File(dir, file).
